Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery volute-krater; exterior unevenly fired and worn. Interior glazed black with added red band around rim; top of rim reserved with red band at inner and outer edges; exterior: on edge of rim, key maeander running left; below, black-figure decoration consisting of part of three riders to right (from left, foreparts of bridled horse, right leg of rider carrying two spears with red tips; centre horse with red tail and mane, head lost and rider with possibly red petasos, peltast with trace of red on back, two spears; at right, red tail of horse); inset below, glazed as far as preserved, with red band on underside.
Curator's comments: The sherd possibly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1235.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 285, no. B254)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0174) (Phase 1)
